FacilityName: The Pictsweet Company - Clarksville, AR Plant

_prev_prog_3.Description: The Pictsweet Company is in compliance with OSHA Standard 29CFR 1910.119, Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals. Administrative and engineering controls in place to reduce the possibility of an accidental release of ammonia. The PSM program is currently under going clerical revisions. Electronic ammonia detection located in each machine room bay (total of 3 sensors). Detection system activates a central audible alarm system to alert personnel of a potential emergency. Machine room detection activates exhaust fans to vent room and exhausts away from personnel to eliminate exposure during venting. High and low level switches are installed on all pressure vessels (excluding oil pots) to alert refrigeration personnel of any deviations from normal operating conditions within a particular vessel or the system as a whole. Safety relief valves are configured to all pressure vessels, condensers, and oil separators to eliminate possible over pressurization within particular pieces of equipment and the system as a whole. Refrigeration operators make rounds every four hours and log equipment status to track system performance.Production operates 6:00 am - 12:00 am with fire watch/security on duty to cover the off shift hours and holidays. During off shift hours a refrigeration tech is on call for security to notify in case of emergency. Periodic preventive maintenance programs are in place to ensure the enitre system is maintained in optimum operational and mechanical conditions at all times.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Pictsweet Company

Clarksville, Arkansas



EPA Risk Management Program 

Executive Summary

July 13, 2012



I .Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The Pictsweet Company complies with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations. Management commitment to safety is foremost and is implemented through numerous policies and procedures. These include policies related to specific regulatory programs; notification and response procedures; emergency action procedures including ammonia release, evacuation, chemical spills, and facility security. Employees are routinely trained in general safety, work place hazards, and handling of hazardous materials. Contractors are informed of company procedures and work place hazards. Bright Harvest is involved with the local LEPC and is current as to emergency support and responsibilities in case of and emergency.



II.Facility and Regulated Substances

The Pictsweet Company is located and know locally as I-40 exit 58, end of Taylor Road (frontage) and is identified for 911 emergency services as 509 Taylor Road. Raw sweet potatoes are received, washed, peeled, trimmed, cut, cooked, mixed, formed, frozen, and packaged. Anhydrous ammonia, liquefied under pressure is used in a closed loop system for cooling, freezing, and frozen storage. There are approximately 20,000 lbs of ammonia on site. Bright Harvest also complies with applicable environmental regulations to control chemical spills and the possibility of contamination to storm water and or effluent streams.



III.Worst Case and Alternate Case Release Scenarios

The Pictsweet Company maintains current worst and alternate release scenarios as a component to support emergency response and planning within the site and LEPC. 



IV.General Accidental Release Prevention Program

The Pictsweet Company complies with OSHA Process Safety Management for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (PSM) standards relative to anhydrous ammonia. Programs are in place to en

sure proper operation and maintenance of the ammonia system; initial and refresher training of operators and maintenance; ensuring the system is designed and maintained to meet industry and engineering standards; and regularly scheduled inspections by qualified external contractors to ensure system integrity. The system includes various detection devices, emergency shutdown devices, and safety relief valves to avert serious over pressurization. An effective preventive maintenance program is in place to ensure proper maintenance activities and schedules. The facility maintains 24 hour security including routine visual checks of the ammonia system during operation and downtime. Emergency contact protocol is in place.



V.Five Year Accident History

There have been no ammonia releases during the past five years that have resulted in an offsite evacuation or reportable incident.



VI.Emergency Response Program

At this facility the primary emphasis is to safely evacuate all employees in the event of an accidental release, pursuant to the requirements of OSHA 1910.38 (a). Coordination with the local fire department and LEPC is initiated during an emergency situation.



VII.Safety Improvement

The Pictsweet Company through outside contractors, inspections, audits, and employee input. Safety training is scheduled at a minimum of annually to ensure employees are informed of current activities and regulatory requirements.
